name: Name
tosecdesc: The Old School Emulation Center (TOSEC) is a retrocomputing initiative dedicated to the cataloging and preservation of software, firmware and resources for arcade machines, microcomputers, minicomputers and video game consoles. The main goal of the project is to catalog and audit various kinds of software and firmware images for these systems.
nointrodesc: No-Intro catalogs the best available copies of ROMs and digital games, providing DAT files for ROM managers and an online database.
redumpdesc: Redump is a database of disc images, including CD-ROMs, DVDs, and other optical media. The database is intended to be a comprehensive archive of all known disc images.
progettodesc: Provides DATs for MAME and MESS.

homepageintro:
What is Hasheous?

Hasheous is a free service that matches MD5 or SHA1 hashes of ROMs and digital games with metadata providers for those games.

How does it work?

When adding a ROM to a supported ROM manager;

  • the hash of the ROM is sent to Hasheous
  • Hasheous looks in its internal database to see if there is an existing match - if so, it returns the links to the stored metadata to the calling client
  • if there is no match, Hasheous will attempt to search the supported metadata providers and return its findings to the calling client, and stores the metadata match to the database for any further lookups

If a match is incorrect, or missing, then the user of the ROM manager manually corrects the data in their local ROM manager, then the fix will be sent to Hasheous as a 'vote'. Once a match has enough votes, the value of the match will change to match the community consensus.
termsofservicetext:
Hasheous is a free service provided to the community with the aim of fairly satisfying the needs of the community.

As such, Hasheous has a rate limiter, and caching in place in order to limit the impact to the service (and therefore the cost of hosting) due to heavy users.

The Hasheous team reserves the right to suspend or block users who:

  • exceed or circumvent these limits and place undue strain on the service
  • engage in offensive or abusive activity while using the service
privacypolicytext:
What data does Hasheous collect?

Hasheous collects data about the users of its services. The following data is collected:

  • Email address
  • Password
  • Language
  • Game Match Submissions

How does Hasheous use your data?

Hasheous uses your data in the following ways:

  • For authentication
  • For sending you notifications
  • For displaying the Hasheous UI
  • For storing your game match submissions. Submissions are stored using an internal user identifier to prevent duplicate submissions.

How does Hasheous share your data?

Hasheous does not share your data with any third parties, unless legally obliged.

How does Hasheous protect your data?

Hasheous uses industry standard security measures to keep your data secure.

  • Mandatory HTTPS
  • Passwords are salted and hashed when stored

What rights does Hasheous have?

Hasheous retains only the right to use your Game Match Submissions.

You can delete your account at anytime, however your Game Match Submissions remain in the Hasheous database. The account and all user identifiers will be deleted immediately, which will remove the link to your Game Match Submissions.

You can contact Hasheous if you have any questions about this.

How can I contact Hasheous?

You can contact Hasheous via our GitHub repository: https://github.com/hasheous/hasheous or, via Discord https://discord.gg/Nhu7wpT3k4

Changes to this Privacy Policy

Hasheous will update this Privacy Policy from time to time. The updated version will be posted on this page.
